column4: Hello everyone. I've got a few questions. I am debating between Ubuntu and Xubuntu. Could someone tell me why Xubuntu is inferior to Ubuntu?
I am a total Linux n00b.
Xubuntu runs xfce, which is a much lighter GUI than GNome(Ubuntu)..
generally... old, slow PC.. xubuntu.., newer PC, Ubuntu
this is addressed on Xubuntu's site.
if you have a new PC, use whichever one you want
they are essentially the same, use whichever one you want.
what works on one, works on the other.
these are all things you can find with a very brief google search.
wel, nobody could possibly be that dense..
the only thing thats different, is the GUI, thats it, "under the hood", OS's are all the same
only way you learn, is to read
every single question you've asked, is answered on each page's download site
but there's no reason to flood a support channel, with questions like this, when all the info is on the sites you downloaded the iso's from
you can't answer a PM cuz your nick isn't registered
the installer has a disk partitioner, you'lll need to set a partition of your disk for Linux(usually at least 10gigs).., that should leave windows untouched if done properly, but backup your data.
